installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Valheim Installation Script
# Colors
GR='\033[0;32m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Server Files: /vhs/server
# Image to install with is 'debian:buster-slim'
apt -y update
apt -y --no-install-recommends --no-install-suggests install curl lib32gcc1 ca-certificates

## create files to install server
sudo mkdir -p /vhs/server/umod
sudo chown -R $user:$user /vhs
cd /vhs/server/umod
export HOME=/vhs/server

# uMod fails otherwise for some reason, even running as root.
# This is changed at the end of the install process anyways.
## install game using uMod Tool
curl -sSL https://umod.io/umod-develop.sh | bash /dev/stdin
. ~/.profile
umod install valheim -P
umod new launcher -P

## Deleting old launcher.sh
sudo rm -rf launcher.sh

## Creating new launcher.sh
echo #!/bin/bash >> launcher.sh
echo export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=./linux64:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH >> launcher.sh
echo while : >> launcher.sh
echo do >> launcher.sh
echo printf "\033c" >> launcher.sh
echo UPDATE_RESULT=$(exec umod update game core apps extensions --patch-available --strict --validate --prerelease) >> launcher.sh
echo status = $? >> launcher.sh
echo if [ status == 1 ] >> launcher.sh
echo then >> launcher.sh
echo echo "Unable to update game, uMod core, or uMod apps" >> launcher.sh
echo elif [ status == 2 ] >> launcher.sh
echo then >> launcher.sh
echo echo "No updated needed" >> launcher.sh
echo fi >> launcher.sh
echo echo "Starting server..." >> launcher.sh
echo ./valheim_server.x86_64 -batchmode -nographics -name "My uMod Server" -port 2456 -world "Dedicated" -password "secret" -public 1 >> launcher.sh
echo echo "Restarting server..." >> launcher.sh
echo sleep 10 >> launcher.sh
echo done >> launcher.sh

## Starting at firs time
clear
echo -e ${GR}This script was made by:
echo -e John P. - CastBlacKing
echo -e Benites - BOSS${NC}
echo --------
echo -e ${RED}Starting Server...${NC}
sleep 5
bash launcher.sh
